intro: Brathys euphorbioides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often unusual floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures typical of the spurge family. Brathys euphorbioides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
